alert.note: Alert for Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 6:10PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central San Miguel County through 645 PM MDT... At 610 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Slick Rock, or 23 miles east of Monticello, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central San Miguel County, including the following locations... Egnar. This includes Colorado 141 between mile markers 9 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River
